intro: Reboulea nitida var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth reboulea, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and lance-shaped leaves. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
